JobFullDesc: *Job Description:  Raytheon Technologies Corporation has an opening for a Sr. Engineer – Project Architect.  This is a designer position with emphasis on gathering, organizing, and dissemination of technical project requirements for the preparation of schematic, design development, and construction drawings for tenant improvements, factory modifications, rearrangements, and new construction.    The Project Architect interacts on a recurring basis through the life of the project with the Project Manager (PM) to review and update the PM regarding project progress, schedule, project resources, scope of work, deliverables, and those issues or related information that impacts the cost, schedule, and scope of the project.  The Project Architect shall interface with the PM in the initial stages of the project to coordinate on the scope and delivery method for the project.   Emphasis of this role is work on Facility projects and not projects for the general public.Job Description: Lead the design team and establish the scope and schedule for the team.Act in a Job Captain role by directing the work efforts of other engineers within a project team.Coordinate the drawing information of mechanical, electrical, civil, structural, security, and other engineering disciplines into a cohesive drawing package, for consistency in contract language, format, drawing standards, and alignment on information provided.Prepare design and construction documentation which define content, materials, and relationships of the building elements.Receive, review, and disseminate shop drawing packages and technical drawings from contractors and coordinate information review with engineering staff for content and compliance with construction documents.Define and engage the technical resource needed to complete the final design and construction drawings.Conduct intermediate design reviews with customers, engineers, consultants, and other stake holders for alignment of project design with initial project scope.Understand IBC for exiting, and relevant code compliance and ADA accessibility guidelines.Perform drafting as needed to support others.  Setup master drawings for the design teamPerform critiques and red line evaluation of the drawings of peers for compliance with standard drawing practice and clarity of content of the information within the drawings.Required Skills: Experience in effectively leading a project team of professional engineers from project design through preparation of construction documents and construction, in acting in the role of Job Captain (Projects ranging from $5,000 to $2,000,000)Extensive experience with CAD software, and Microsoft office systems in the preparation of construction documentsProficient use of CAD software in setting up drawing master files for use by other disciplinesAnalytical skills to decipher the essential project goals and enlist the necessary resources to achieve those goals Free hand or CAD drawing skills demonstrating the ability to document existing field conditions, to propose new concepts, communicate building component relationships to others, as well as organize technical informationLeadership of a design team through project development in defining content, schedule, scope, and deliverablesFamiliarity with current International Building Code and related codes to be able to apply code references Desired Skills: Proficient experience with Microstation CAD platform and setting up drawing files. Construction administration background in directly managing projects of various scales.Prior experience using Microsoft Project as a scheduling tool to establish project deliverable timeline.Demonstrated experience working with staff in the successful completion of building projects.Registered Architect in the state of Arizona. Education Requirements:This position typically requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or related discipline and 4 or more years of applicable professional experienceUS Citizenship: This position may require access to systems/tools that are restricted to individuals who possess US citizenship
